meanings.definition: A foolish or extravagant belief or idea
meanings.sent1: Her folie about finding a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow led her on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent2: His folie that he could fly like a bird almost got him into trouble.
meanings.sent3: The folie that aliens were living in her backyard made her set up a telescope to watch for them.
meanings.sent4: His folie that he was a superhero in disguise made him wear a cape everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The folie that eating only green foods would make her invisible was both amusing and strange.

meanings.definition: A mental disorder characterized by delusions of grandeur or persecution
meanings.sent1: His folie made him believe he was a king ruling over a vast kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The patient's folie led him to think that everyone was plotting against him.
meanings.sent3: The folie that he was a secret agent on a mission to save the world made him act suspiciously.
meanings.sent4: Her folie of being a famous celebrity trapped in a small town was both sad and intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The folie that he was a time traveler from the future fascinated everyone around him.

meanings.definition: A building or structure designed in a fanciful or extravagant style
meanings.sent1: The castle was a beautiful folie with its intricate carvings and colorful towers.
meanings.sent2: The architect's folie was a whimsical house with spiraling staircases and hidden rooms.
meanings.sent3: The folie in the park looked like it came straight out of a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: The hotel's folie was a blend of modern design and classic elegance.
meanings.sent5: The folie on the hill stood out with its bright colors and unique shapes.
